firstTimeSetup.title: Welcome to HourWise!
firstTimeSetup.subtitle: A few steps to get you started correctly:
firstTimeSetup.step1: Enable All Permissions: For automatic driving detection to work, please grant all permissions, especially setting Location to 'Allow all the time'.
firstTimeSetup.step2: Complete Driver Setup: Fill in your details. This is essential for reports and optional pay calculations.
firstTimeSetup.step3: Enter Your Last Shift: Go to Menu > Work History and add your last completed shift. This is crucial for correct daily rest calculation.

driverSetup.title: Driver Setup
driverSetup.notAuthenticated: User not authenticated. Please restart the app.

disclaimer.title: Official Guidance First
disclaimer.body: This app is a powerful tool to aid compliance, but it is not a replacement for official training or legal advice. Always refer to EU regulations and your company policy.

step1.title: 1. Enter Your Last Shift (Crucial!)
step1.body: For correct 'Daily Rest' calculation, you MUST manually enter details of your last completed shift. Go to Menu -> Work History -> tap the correct date and add the shift.

step2.title: 2. Complete Your Driver Profile
step2.body: Go to Settings (gear icon) -> Driver Setup. Your name is required for reports. Pay details are optional for generating invoices.

step3.title: 3. Add Business Details (Optional)
step3.body: For invoicing, go to Settings -> Business Profile. Your details will automatically appear on generated PDF invoices.

step1.title: 1. Start & End Your Shift
step1.body: Use the main 'Start Shift' and 'End Shift' buttons. At the end of a shift, a confirmation screen will show your totals and any violations.

step2.title: 2. Automatic Driving Detection
step2.body: The app automatically detects driving based on speed and motion, switching your status to 'Driving'. When you stop, it reverts to 'Working'.

step3.title: 3. Taking a Break
step3.body: Press 'Start Break' to pause your work timers. The app tracks the total break duration. A continuous break of at least 45 minutes will reset your 4.5-hour driving timer.

step4.title: 4. Period of Availability (POA)
step4.body: Use 'POA / Waiting Time' for periods when you are available but not actively working (e.g., waiting for a loading bay). This time is tracked separately from work and breaks.

fatigue.title: Fatigue & Focus Monitor
fatigue.body: This appears on the main screen during your shift, providing real-time compliance warnings for insufficient daily rest, upcoming break requirements, and driving/work time limits.

compliance.title: Compliance Heatmap
compliance.body: Visible on the dashboard and in the menu. This calendar shows your compliance score for each day. Tap it to see a detailed monthly view and identify any days with issues.

history.title: Work History & Manual Edits
history.body: From the Main Menu (top left), select 'Work History' to view past shifts. Here you can tap any day to see a detailed summary, and manually add or edit past shifts to correct your records.

expenses.title: Add & Track Expenses
expenses.body: From the Main Menu, select 'Add Expense' to log costs like fuel or meals. You can scan receipts with your camera, and the app will try to automatically fill in the amount.

reports.title: Download Reports & Invoices
reports.body: From the Main Menu, select 'Download Report' to generate a professional PDF of your work summary or a customer invoice for any date range.

dailyReport.title: Daily Compliance Report
dailyReport.body: When you open the app for the first time each day, you may see a pop-up summarizing any compliance violations from the previous day's shift.

about.title: About these rules
about.description: This screen summarises key EU drivers’ hours and working time guidance. Always follow official regulations and your company policy.

overview.title: Overview
overview.point1: Track work, breaks, POA, and driving accurately.
overview.point2: Plan breaks and rest early to avoid infringements.
overview.point3: Use reduced rest and driving extensions carefully.

drivingLimits.title: Driving Time Limits

daily.label: Daily driving limit:
daily.description: 9 hours (can be extended to 10 hours twice per week).

breaks.label: Driving breaks:
breaks.description: After 4.5 hours driving, take 45 minutes break.

drivingLimits.breaksSplitExample: The 45 minutes can be split into 15 minutes + 30 minutes (in that order).

daily.title: Daily rest:
daily.regular: Regular daily rest: at least 11 hours.
daily.reduced: Reduced daily rest: at least 9 hours (limited use).
daily.split: Split daily rest: must total at least 12 hours (e.g., 3 + 9).

weekly.title: Weekly rest:
weekly.regular: Regular weekly rest: at least 45 hours.
weekly.reduced: Reduced weekly rest: at least 24 hours (compensation required).
weekly.frequency: Weekly rest must be taken within required rolling periods.

avgWeekly.label: Average weekly working time:
avgWeekly.description: 48 hours on average over the reference period.

nightWork.label: Night work limit:
nightWork.description: Typically 10 hours in any 24-hour period (subject to rules).

workBreaks.title: Working Time Break Requirements
workBreaks.intro: Working time breaks depend on total hours worked.

rules.sixToNine: If you work more than 6 hours: take at least 30 minutes break (total).
rules.ninePlus: If you work more than 9 hours: take at least 45 minutes break (total).

workBreaks.noteDriving: Driving breaks (4.5h rule) are separate and must also be respected.

interaction.title: How the app tracks this
interaction.point1: Work and driving timers run while you’re active; POA pauses work-cycle time.
interaction.point2: A qualifying break can reset your 4.5-hour driving cycle.

prepare.title: Prepare
prepare.point2: Make sure the tachograph is in manual entry mode if needed.
prepare.point3: Check the time and timezone settings on the unit.

confirmManualEntry.title: Confirm manual entry
confirmManualEntry.point1: Confirm you want to add activities since your last card removal.

enterActivities.title: Enter activities
enterActivities.point2: Enter the start time and end time accurately.
enterActivities.point4: Double-check the sequence matches what actually happened.

adjustTimes.title: Adjust times
adjustTimes.point1: If times look wrong, go back and correct them.
adjustTimes.point2: Make sure there are no overlaps or gaps.
adjustTimes.point3: Confirm each entry before moving on.

confirm.title: Confirm
confirm.point1: Review the summary on the tachograph screen.
confirm.point2: Accept to save the manual entries.

finalCheck.title: Final check
finalCheck.point1: Verify the activity timeline is correct.
finalCheck.point2: Begin your shift only when everything looks right.

privacyIntro: We are committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains what data HourWise collects to provide its features, how it's stored, and how you remain in control of your information.
privacyWhyDesc: We only collect data that is essential for the app's core functionality, such as calculating your work hours, ensuring compliance with EU regulations, and generating accurate reports and invoices.
privacyDataCollectedDesc: To enable all features, we securely store the following information you provide:
privacyDataPoints: Your recorded shifts (start/end times, driving, work, breaks, POA)
Location data (solely for automatic driving detection)
Expense details, including receipt images and extracted text
Pay configuration settings (optional, for pay estimates)
Business profile and bank details (optional, for invoicing)
privacyStorageDesc: Your data is stored in your own private, secure cloud account, synchronized across your devices. We use industry-standard encryption to protect it both in transit and at rest.
privacyControlDesc: The data stored is the data you create. You have the ability to view, edit, and permanently delete your work history, expenses, and personal information at any time through the app.
privacyThirdPartyDesc: To provide features like receipt scanning, we may send data to third-party services. For instance, receipt images are sent to an OCR service to extract text. We do not share your data for marketing or advertising purposes.
privacyDisclaimer: While we use a secure, industry-standard system, no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure. We cannot guarantee absolute security but are fully committed to protecting your data.

privacy.gdprRightsDesc: Under GDPR, you have the right to access, rectify, or erase your personal data. You can manage these rights directly in the app or submit a formal request via our online portal.

delete.title: Delete My Account
delete.confirmMessage: This will permanently erase your shift history, compliance records, and profile. This action cannot be undone.
delete.successMessage: Your account and all associated data have been permanently removed.
delete.errorMessage: We could not delete your account at this time. Please contact support.

EXCEEDED_6H_WORK.title: Exceeded 6 Hours Work Without Break
EXCEEDED_6H_WORK.tip: A 30-minute break is required after 6 hours of work. Plan your breaks accordingly.

INSUFFICIENT_BREAK_FOR_9H_WORK.title: Insufficient Break for >9 Hours Work
INSUFFICIENT_BREAK_FOR_9H_WORK.tip: For shifts over 9 hours, a total of 45 minutes in breaks is required.

INSUFFICIENT_DAILY_REST.title: Insufficient Daily Rest
INSUFFICIENT_DAILY_REST.tip: Ensure you take at least 11 hours of daily rest between shifts. This can be reduced to 9 hours three times a week.

REDUCED_DAILY_REST_TAKEN.title: Reduced Daily Rest Taken
REDUCED_DAILY_REST_TAKEN.tip: You have taken a reduced daily rest period. Remember, you can only do this three times between any two weekly rest periods.

EXCEEDED_4_5H_DRIVING.title: Exceeded 4.5 Hours Driving
EXCEEDED_4_5H_DRIVING.tip: You must take a 45-minute break after 4.5 hours of continuous driving.

EXCEEDED_DAILY_DRIVING_LIMIT.title: Exceeded Daily Driving Limit
EXCEEDED_DAILY_DRIVING_LIMIT.tip: Daily driving is limited to 9 hours, extendable to 10 hours only twice a week.

USED_10H_DRIVING_EXTENSION.title: 10-Hour Driving Extension Used
USED_10H_DRIVING_EXTENSION.tip: You have used one of your two weekly 10-hour driving extensions.

EXCEEDED_WEEKLY_DRIVING_LIMIT.title: Exceeded Weekly Driving Limit
EXCEEDED_WEEKLY_DRIVING_LIMIT.tip: The maximum weekly driving time is 56 hours. Plan your weeks carefully to stay within this limit.

EXCEEDED_WEEKLY_WORK_LIMIT.title: Exceeded Weekly Work Limit
EXCEEDED_WEEKLY_WORK_LIMIT.tip: The maximum weekly working time is 60 hours in any single week. Ensure you take adequate rest.

WORK_TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED.title: Work Time Limit Exceeded
WORK_TIME_LIMIT_EXCEEDED.tip: You exceeded your work cycle limit. The overage of {{time}} has been recorded.

FORTNIGHTLY_DRIVING_LIMIT_EXCEEDED.title: Exceeded Fortnightly Driving Limit
FORTNIGHTLY_DRIVING_LIMIT_EXCEEDED.tip: The maximum driving time in any two consecutive weeks is 90 hours.
